page.title: 15EMPLOYMENT LANCING W.SUSSEX
page.content: On the site of the Industrial Estate there used to be a railway carriage works established in 1913 by L.B.& S.C railways.We interviewed Mr.and Mrs R.A Walker who both worked there. There were up to 2000 workers at the site with muth of the residential area being built for its employees.The work carried out was the repair and construction of passenger carriage stock for the southern railway.It was later used by B.R. when the railways were nationalised the works were used for the standardisation of carriages.Theworks were shut in June 1965.Notice of closure was given 3 years in advance.Athough their was plenty of employment in the aera by the time the works closed.Men who had worked their all their lives found it hard to get jobs,and one man committed suicide.
